conclusion: Liquid will flow out from openings A, B, and C and needs to be predicted which container D, E, or F it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Opening A is orange, opening B is blue, and opening C is white. Containers D, E, and F are blue, white, and black respectively.
There are slanted plates (baffles) in the image: purple, cyan, green, and brown, positioned to deflect liquid flow.
Liquid starting at opening A is deflected by the purple slanted plate and follows a path leading to container D.
Liquid starting at opening B is guided by the cyan and green baffles into container E.
Liquid starting at opening C follows the deflection path of the brown plate and reaches container F.
The predicted outlet mapping is A → D, B → E, C → F.
